verses.verse: (A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A Song.) His foundation<WH3248> is in the holy<WH6944> mountains.<WH2022>
The Lord<WH3068> loves<WH157> the gates<WH8179> of Zion<WH6726> More<WH4480> than<WH4480> all<WH3605> the [other] dwelling<WH4908> places<WH4908> of Jacob.<WH3290>
Glorious<WH3513> things<WH3513> are spoken<WH1696> of you, O city<WH5892> of God.<WH430> Selah.<WH5542>

"I shall mention<WH2142> Rahab<WH7294> and Babylon<WH894> among those who know<WH3045> Me; Behold,<WH2009> Philistia<WH6429> and Tyre<WH6865> with Ethiopia:<WH3568> 'This<WH2088> one<WH2088> was born<WH3205> there.<WH8033>'"
But of Zion<WH6726> it shall be said,<WH559> "This<WH376> one<WH376> and that one<WH376> were born<WH3205> in her"; And the Most<WH9411> High<WH9411> Himself<WH1931> will establish<WH3559> her.
The Lord<WH3068> shall count<WH5608> when He registers<WH3789> the peoples,<WH5971> "This<WH2088> one<WH2088> was born<WH3205> there.<WH8033>" Selah.<WH5542>
Then those who sing<WH7891> as well as those who play<WH9136> the flutes<WH9136> [shall say], "All<WH3605> my springs<WH4599> [of joy] are in you."
